text:
@WyrdWombman Twitter is full of people who conflate "neurodiversity" with "autism", and it really does a lot of damage to a lot of people who feel left out, ignored, or sidelined.

text:
Our strength is found in diversity, when it's based in unity.

Our longing for oneness (the sum of all differences) which has been confused with sameness (no differences at all) paves the road to our extinction.

Learn to appreciate diversity!

#Neurodiversity
#AutismPrideDay

text: @kirstycrinson @AnnMemmott @SueReviews @Noahsasson Neurodiversity includes typical as well as neurodivergent (atypical). Neurodivergent includes neurodevelopmental conditions like autism and dyspraxia, but also also dementia, brain tumours, hydrocephalus, etc..

text: @kirstycrinson @AnnMemmott @SueReviews @Noahsasson Diversity is the way organisms differ from one another. Neurodiversity (a cultural, not medical, term) refers to the way human brains differ from one another. Literally ever single person is part of nurodiversity, i.e. the neurological diversity of the human species.

@Kan0chan @HowtoADHD Key: What's the goal in telling him?

Many goals won't *need* a mental health or neurodiversity framing

"Dad, how do you plan/carry out this task?"

text: @NicoleArbour Hi Nicole! So, its pretty clear you're not very educated about ADHD, which is a widely recognized neurodiversity characterized by lower amounts of neurotransmitters such as dopamine as well as actual, measurable *structural* differences in the brain, so let me enlighten you.

text: Neurodiversity includes autism, adhd, did and plurality, and many other experiences of brain and mind that diverge from the "neurotypical" - there are many neurodivergent people on the streets, called "difficult" and "treatment resistant" YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND US.

text: Neurodivergent (adj of Neurodiversity) folks are part of every social movement we have encountered and our different way of perceiving things makes us both unique contributors and vulnerable to intra-movement shaming and exploitation.
